result.execSummary:
The defendant Keshun V Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to Marathon Co. cases 2013CF617 and 2013CF698.

miscConds.notes: Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not must complete 5 hours community service and 2 verifiable job contacts; High School Diploma or equivalent.

Counseling.
Sexual Awareness Class.
Court does not order Sex Offender Registry at this time - only if revoked.
No credit in this file. 
Defendant to see Probation today after being released. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
Defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse program if revoked on Extended Supervision. 

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: with huber for work/school/treatment if deft qualifies.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called: 3:49pm. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 13CF617, 13CF698, 14CF327. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty John Bachman. Matter is set by Court regarding time served on Initial Confinement sentence.  State makes statement regarding conversation with Registrar from Dodge Corrections, jail staff and recites statute regarding matter and clarification of sentencing.  COURT makes statement. Atty Wallace makes statement and in agreement.  Adjourned: 3:54pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 2:26pm. Clerk: Denise. INCLUDES 13CF617, 13CF698 - SAR, 14CF327- Sentencing.  State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty John Wallace. State recites agreement to SAR and Sentencing. *VRCW. Atty Wallace in agreement and is in agreement of BR 1 handling BR 3 matters. Defendant also in agreement. Further statements by State & Defense.  Defendant makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: 13CF617-  Ct 1 -  WI State Prison Total 39 months; Initial Confinement 15 months; Exended Supervision 24 months. Credit 481 days time served.
COURT ORDERS: 13CF698-  WI State Prison Total 39 months; Initial Confinement 15 months; Exended Supervision 24 months. Credit 481 days time served. Sentence concurrent to 13CF617. Stipulation of Resitution of $1,500 owed to G.E. and is joint & several with co-defendant R.C. in 13CF704 with payments to be paid until 13CF698 - Extended Supervision Condition. 
COURT ORDERS: 14CF327 - SWH - 1 yr probation, consecutive to SAR sentences. CONDITIONS: Counseling; No contact with J.N.S.; Good faith effort to obtain and maintain fulltime employment and/or school and if not must complete 5 hrs Community Service and 2 verifiable job contacts; High School Diploma or equivalent; Sexual Awareness Class; Court Costs. Court does not order Sex Offender Registry - only if revoked. Defendant is eligible for challenge incarceration and substance abuse program if revoked on Extended Supervision. Copy of CR 234 given to Defendant after Court. Court addresses court ordered obligations. Court continues order under Extended Supervision. State indicates no credit on 14CF327- crt grants.  Adjourned: 2:45pm. BOTR @ 2:48pm. Court orders Defendant must see Probation today after being released. Adjourned: 2:48pm.

Clerk Shirley

Sentencing to take place in Br. 1 on Friday.

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): J.M.S. or females under age 18. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
